div.head: Russian Specifications
div.docAuthor: Serge Sharoff, Mikhail Kopotev, Tomaž Erjavec, Anna Feldman, Dagmar Divjak

div.head: Introduction to Russian Specifications
div.p:
The Russian MULTEXT-East specifications were developed in the scope of an effort to produce a publicly available tagged corpus of Russian; this corpus and accompanying resources are available from http://corpus.leeds.ac.uk/mocky/. The morphosyntactic specifications and corpus are documented in:
Serge Sharoff, Mikhail Kopotev, Tomaž Erjavec, Anna Feldman, Dagmar Divjak.
Designing and evaluating Russian tagsets. In Proc. LREC 2008, Marrakech, May, 2008.

list.item: Gender=common is used for words such as судья, коллега, чукча, саша, убийца, etc.

Case2 attribute is used to mark non-standard cases to nouns (e.g. партитив and локатив), so that such nouns are still in the genitive or locative Case, while information about case variation is preserved.
Russian specification distinguish Type=Gerund, and hence introduce various nominative properties on Verb, i.e. Definiteness, Case.

Type=nonspecific marks the following Russian words: весь 'all', всякий 'any, every', сам 'oneself', самый 'the very', каждый 'every, each', иной 'other', любой 'any', другой 'other'. The name "nonspecific" follows Halliday's Introduction to Functional Grammar, Section 6.2.1.1.

div.head: Russian Attribute Index
div.p: In this section all the attributes presented in the tables are listed in alphabetical order.

div.head: Russian Value Index
div.p: The values presented within the tables are, in the following, listed in alphabetical order; the first column gives the name of the value, the second column its code and the third lists attributes for which the value is appropriate.

div.head: Russian MSD Index
div.p: This index gives the (hopefully) correct and complete list of morphosyntactic descriptions and their features. The first column gives the MSD, the second its expansion into a feature-structure, the thrid the frequency of word tokens and the fourth the number of word types tagged with this MSD, with the fifth giving some examples as word-form/lemma, where the latter is omitted when the two are identical.
